results.headline: Review: ‘Eisenstein in Guanajuato’ Explores 10 Days That Changed a Filmmaker’s Life and Work
results.summary_short: This comedic fantasy from Peter Greenaway about Sergei Eisenstein’s trip to Mexico in the 1930s quotes Eisenstein at length, while imagining a scandalous personal life.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Eisenstein in Guanajuato

results.headline: Review: In ‘Rams,’ Brothers at Odds Face a Shared Threat to Their Livelihood
results.summary_short: The sources of the bad blood are never specified, but it trickles though Grimur Hakonarson’s new film, in some respects a familiar kind of Nordic comedy.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Rams

results.headline: Review: In ‘Saala Khadoos,’ a Female Boxer Rises From the Streets in India
results.summary_short: With a rawness that dovetails with the role, the newcomer Ritika Singh stars in this Bollywood film, with her coach played by the seasoned R. Madhavan.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Saala Khadoos

results.headline: Review: ‘Fifty Shades of Black’ Sells Sex With (Intentional) Laughs
results.summary_short: This satire starring and co-written by Marlon Wayans has fun with the screen adaptation of a certain best-selling book.

link.suggested_link_text: Read the New York Times Review of Fifty Shades of Black

results.headline: Review: In ‘Jane Got a Gun,’ Clear Skies, Followed by a Hail of Bullets
results.summary_short: Natalie Portman plays a frontier wife who enlists the aid of a former lover, portrayed by Joel Edgerton, to defend her home.

results.headline: Review: Noam Chomsky Focuses on Financial Inequality in ‘Requiem for the American Dream’
results.summary_short: In the documentary “Requiem for the American Dream,” Mr. Chomsky conjures a sobering vision of a society in an accelerating decline.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Mountain Men,’ Two Brothers Are Forced to Work Things Out
results.summary_short: This Cameron Labine film features mismatched siblings and a road trip gone wrong.

results.headline: Review: In ‘Lazer Team,’ Bickering Losers Try to Save the World
results.summary_short: Four small-town idiots accidentally end up in possession of a suit of high-tech armor that is Earth’s best defense against an invasion from outer space.

results.headline: Review: Amos Gitai’s ‘Rabin, the Last Day’ Looks Back in Anguish
results.summary_short: Mr. Gitai’s new film delves into the incendiary political culture that led to the assassination of Prime Minister Yitzhak Rabin of Israel in 1995.

results.headline: Review: ‘The Finest Hours’ Stars Chris Pine, Leading a Mission Against All Odds
results.summary_short: Based on a real-life 1952 rescue of men aboard a tanker in a brutal storm, this nostalgic film also features Casey Affleck as a heroic shipboard engineer.

results.headline: In ‘Kung Fu Panda 3,’ a New Dad Who Talks Like Bryan Cranston
results.summary_short: The film’s central character, voiced by Jack Black, reunites with his long-lost father just as all of China is menaced by a fearsome beast.

results.headline: Review: ‘The Boy,’ in Which a Doll May be Alive, or the Heroine May Be Mad
results.summary_short: Lauren Cohan stars in this small-cast thriller, directed by William Brent Bell, which has enough scary moments to satisfy horror fans.

results.headline: Review: Keanu Reeves Undertakes an Investigation in ‘Exposed’
results.summary_short: The appearance of angels, an unexpected birth and a violent death coincide in this drama, written by Gee Malik Linton.

results.headline: Review: ‘Dirty Grandpa’ Features Robert De Niro on the Prowl
results.summary_short: In this comedy directed by Dan Mazer, Mr. De Niro’s character cajoles his grandson to take a road trip to Florida with him in time for spring break.

results.headline: Review: ‘Aferim!’ Traverses an Unforgiving Romania in the 1800s
results.summary_short: Romania’s entry for consideration at the Academy Awards for best foreign-language film, Radu Jude’s historical drama has resonance in our present age.

results.headline: Review: In ‘All Mistakes Buried,’ an Addict Battles to Retrieve a Precious Necklace
results.summary_short: Directed by Tim McCann, the film stars Sam Trammell as a reprobate who takes on dangerous criminals in an effort to save his marriage.

results.headline: Review: To Be Young, Gay and Muslim in Bed-Stuy
results.summary_short: The Islamic taboo against homosexuality weighs on two 18-year-old Muslim best friends who are closeted in Brooklyn.

results.headline: Review: The Aliens Are Coming! The Aliens Are Coming!
results.summary_short: The extraterrestrial Others are conquering Earth. Feisty, if under-informed, teenagers decide to fight back.

results.headline: Review: ‘Synchronicity’ Plays With Time and Love

results.headline: Review: ‘Rabid Dogs,’ a Road Trip With French Robbers
